reviewText: Still one of the best racing sims around: impressive driving physics, detailed car set-up options, awesome sound and plenty of difficulty customizations. Plus it still looks good, you can adjust the graphics in the settings (car details etc). There are settings for a wheel set-up (force feedback etc), however you can play it with a Xbox 360 controller as well. You have four driving perspectives to choose from: cockpit, over the hood, bumper and third person. There are weather effects in the game.\nIt has all sorts of assists: AI difficulty, damage realism, automatic gear shifts, brake and steering help, tire and brake wear, as well as indicative arrows for corners and gears. So in theory anyone can play this game. You can adjust everything of importance: gears, tires, brakes, differential etc. The AI can be adjusted with impressive range: timid, clean, realistic, aggressive etc.\nTo sum it up: great driving physics, awesome sound, nice selection of tracks and cars. GTR gives you an immersive GT experience.
voteText: 39 of 41 people (95%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Don't let the GUI scare you away and you may have to look for the right video mode code (36 and 75 seem to work for NVIDIA 1920x1080) for higher resolutions, but once you're there it is a good solid racing sim.

FFB works well (I'm using a GTDF), graphics is functional for a sim racer and not something that will distract you while racing.

Nice tracks, nice cars.

Old, but gold.
Get it while it's on sale!
voteText: 17 of 17 people (100%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
I have to say, this is a good game.

But if you are going to buy this game, buy GTR 2 too.
More cars, better tracks, more game modes- and also easy to mod.

(P. S. - get a racing wheel. Wheels win races.)

reviewText: I got this game for 1.50 definately well worth it. The game doesnt offer much in terms of things to do though the racing is quite fun and intuitive so the is a minor learning curve but with practice anyone can be good. Anyways great game if you get it cheap.

reviewText: Long in the tooth and superseded by GTR2 but still a very good sim. Really only a necessary purchase for competitionists as GTR2 has basically all the content found in this game plus a whole lot more.\nThe force feedback settings need to be tweaked, (search for feels real to me for GT legends and use those values.) but once you've done that there's still fun to be had here.

reviewText:
I brought this accidently instead of gtr 2, back in the day this was a state of the art game however the times have changing and physics engines have gotten better and graphics have gotten better and sadly this has been left in the dust.

I want to recommend this game but sadly it doesnt have that fun factor that it did so many years ago, there are just so many improvements with games like gtr 2 and race 07 that this needs but didnt exist when this was made. Even further games like Assetto corsa or Rfactor give this a run for its money.

Lastly it may say i have little time in this game but ive clocked in many hours into it and sadly its not aged well.
